meanings.definition: A type of dance in triple time.
meanings.sent1: The sarabands at the party were full of energy and rhythm.
meanings.sent2: The dancers moved gracefully to the sarabands playing in the background.
meanings.sent3: The sarabands seemed to have a life of their own, guiding the dancers effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: The sarabands wove a magical spell over the audience, transporting them to another world.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the sarabands echoed through the hall, enchanting everyone with its melody.

meanings.sent1: The sarabands filled the square with joy and celebration.
meanings.sent2: The traditional sarabands were a favorite at the fiesta.
meanings.sent3: The sarabands made even the shyest dancers tap their feet in excitement.
meanings.sent4: The sarabands set the stage on fire with their infectious rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant sarabands brought a burst of color to the dance floor.

meanings.sent1: The royal court performed the sarabands with grace and elegance.
meanings.sent2: The sarabands were a symbol of sophistication and refinement.
meanings.sent3: The sarabands seemed to glide across the ballroom floor like swans.
meanings.sent4: The sarabands whispered tales of bygone eras and noble traditions.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the sarabands lingered in the air, casting a spell of nostalgia.
